summary: This bill, the Higher Wages for American Workers Act of 2025, proposes to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938. The core components include raising the federal minimum wage to $15, with the first increase taking effect on January 1 of the year following the bill's enactment. Subsequent increases will be determined annually by the Secretary, based on the Consumer Price Index (CPI), to adjust for inflation. The bill also specifies an effective date for the changes.
